channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Deloitte just got caught again citing fabricated and AI-generated research—this time in a million-dollar report for the Canadian government
item.description: In a healthcare report aimed to address a nurse and doctor shortage, Deloitte cited several fake studies with real researchers’ names attached.

item.title: Global e-commerce startup funding hits 2020s low, while 2025 U.S. holiday spending could break records
item.description: In 2021, global e-commerce-related startup funding peaked, but in 2025 those numbers have come crashing down to around $7 billion for the year, per Cr...

item.title: Drug Arrests and Gun Seizures Fell as Homeland Security Pursued Immigration
item.description: Internal documents reveal the impact on crime fighting as the Trump administration diverts special agents to its mass deportation agenda.

item.title: As Trump Pushes to End Ukraine War, Europe Toils to Have a Say
item.description: Initially cut out of development of the 28-point peace plan, European leaders are now trying to recast its pro-Russia slant. So far, it seems to be wo...

item.title: Amazon CTO Werner Vogels just released his 2026 tech predictions. He’s most optimistic about ‘personalized learning’ and ‘renaissance developers’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Trump’s Retribution Campaign Hits a Major Roadblock, and Health Care Costs Set to Surge
item.description: Plus, what a social media break can do for your brain.

item.title: Wall Street is on tenterhooks over the Fed’s ‘rare, genuinely suspenseful’ December meeting—the committee is unsure of the data, and each other
item.description: A divided Fed meets amid mixed jobs and inflation signals, leaving Powell with a suspenseful December.

item.title: Amazon CTO’s 2026 tech predictions include the dawn of the ‘renaissance developer’: ‘You need polymaths like Da Vinci’
item.description: Vogels says his annual list of tech predictions is more optimistic than it may seem.

item.title: Judge Tosses Criminal Charges Against James Comey and Letitia James
item.description: The decision is a setback for the president’s efforts to wield the criminal justice system against his perceived enemies.

item.title: U.S. Plans Compounds to House Palestinians in Israeli-Held Half of Gaza
item.description: The project could offer relief for tens of thousands of Palestinians who have endured two years of war, but has raised questions about whether it coul...

item.title: Australian Senator Suspended for Burqa-Wearing Stunt in Parliament
item.description: Pauline Hanson, the head of the far-right One Nation party, wore the garment as a prop to push legislation to bar the garment in public places.

item.title: As Trump Pushes to End Ukraine War, Europe Toils to Have a Say
item.description: Initially cut out of development of the 28-point peace plan, European leaders are now trying to recast its pro-Russia slant. So far, it seems to be wo...

item.title: U.S. Air Force Searches for Fallen Reaper Drone in Yellow Sea
item.description: The MQ-9 Reaper was conducting a routine mission when it fell into the ocean on Monday near a U.S. military base in South Korea.

item.title: China and Japan, With Trump in the Middle, Stoke an Existential Showdown
item.description: With Japan’s new leader refusing to back down from China’s show of force and claims on Taiwan, Xi Jinping picks up the phone to try to pry the U.S.-Ja...

item.title: Tariffs and Strike Drive ‘Once-in-a-Lifetime’ Boost for Canadian Wine
item.description: The trade war with the United States, bans on U.S. wine and liquor imports and a recent distributor strike in British Columbia have Canadians giving t...
